item.title: What does love see?
item.description:
src

  • Prayer is raising of consciousness where you transcend this world of death
  • prayer is reaching up into this (points higher)
  • one day it will become more real to you than the world of death down here
  • It’s no use to save the world if we are the cause of the trouble
  • The hope is that in spirit you realize the existence of greater life where is no death.
  • Do you meet a lot of realized people? I’ve never met anybody. I would not claim that myself fully, partially at times.
  • Once you start working with spirit there is no need for audience.
  • Spirit doesn’t need public acclaim, his work are unseen, unknown. He’s the real invisible power behind the scenes. It’s the life, the life force. Who’s ever seen it? Who’s ever seen electricity? It’s recognized by its effects.
  • John the baptist: Behold, the lamb of god that takes away the sin of the world.
  • When the heart is melted, what comes out of it? Love. No glorification, no I love you.
  • What does love see? Love sees perfection in the bellowed? Love see no ill. Nothing but loveliness. Love sees purity. The pure in heart see god.
  • There is no need to go to India to look for gurus. Look at the lamb, let your heart be melted, let your tears run and you’ll be as close to god as you ever be. You don’t need a teacher. Teacher is in-front of your nose.
  • My entire life has expressed not what I’m, but what I’m not.
  • You want peace? Stillness? Earth is still, rocks are still. Put your feet on the ground. But the mind likes its own restlessness.
  • If you want to bring the world to peace, star with yourself. That’s the essence of prayer. Heal yourself.
  • The destiny of the world of sin is to rot away. Sin is death. Duality is on death row, duality is death.
  • Real life is in spirit.
  • If you’re serious about helping yourself or even better helping others, put prayer into practice. Practice what you preach. To make whole be whole.
  • Humanism - worship of the body. We think we’re so clever. We completely turn away from the point of life. We miss the true destiny of man - which is spirit, which is the kingdom of heaven.

item.title: Redemption
item.description:
src

  • redemption is that which I cannot do myself. It compels one to look beyond my own failure.
  • What are we going to do about the world my dears? God knows, I don’t.
  • Humanity is a lesson in the consequence of pride.
  • Pride is thinking that we can live without God, without that which is greater than ourselves.
  • If we’re convinced that we know we close the door to anybody else. We thing we’re right.
  • To make whole, be whole. Yet we feel we need to do.
  • Redemption is the return to God
  • Living by grace makes life bearable.
  • It is so easy to focus on the negatives but there is so much good, beauty and love in the world.
  • Life goes on. When man dies another is born. Redemption.

item.title: Is sin just ignorance?
item.description:
src

  • Why do we fall from this blessed state of freedom into this imprisonment we call life. Death by self-imprisonment. We take it as normal. We look down, we don’t look up. The unlimited sky is always there.
  • View from airplane offers best contrast. Problems dissolved - unlimited expansion.
  • Sin is when things go wrong.
  • Mistaken identity. All problems of the world arise from it.
  • Repentance is turning back to freedom again.
  • Unselfishness, you think less about me.
  • We’re all mini Christs. We have to take our cross.
  • It seems I would not say reasonable, but wonderful.
  • Where is that end where spirit, freedom begins?
  • Whatever is happening is contained in this unchanging, ever present, presence of God.
  • You and me and this, what is called the third point. Three - basic building components of all religions. Duality contained in the third.
  • The only problem with duality is that it is in conflict.
  • The duality is only problematic when we forget the third point.
  • Come back to simplicity. Distrust of complexity. Common sense.
  • This present is asking nothing of us, it accepts you as we are. Forgiveness - prime feature of this presence. Most merciful. Forgiving.
  • Where do all these judgements come from? Not coming from user selves?
  • Sin is mistaken identity. Sin is ignorance.
  • Perhaps duality is ignorance of the one.

item.title: Judge not
item.description:
src:

  • When you worry about it these things are only get bigger. You don’t really get rid of ego. Is part of your machinery as man.
  • Get on with life. Attend what is there to attend and forget about your ego. When you do what you love you forget about yourself in the process.
  • What do I do about highs and lows? Just like weather, nothing.
  • Little bed, early to rise, makes the man healthy, wealthy and wise.
  • When I was a little boy “psychology” was not even invented. We’ve lost touch with common sense. We’ve become so unnatural.
  • How to make the world a better place? With 20 years old I tried to do physically, now I pray.
  • Father: mother knows man. As young man: nature knows man. Now: God knows best. Prayer is aligning myself with that. Jesus: into thy hands, oh Lord. I try to surrender not only myself but everything which is contained in my consciousness. There is no better way in which I can serve the world. God knows and I do not but I have faith that this is the best thing I can do.
  • One of the most damaging aspects of the ego - judging and critizising others. Jesus: judge not! Judging puts our selves in prison. “I’m right and he’s wrong”. Let God be the judge.
  • Wars are like futball matches. You support one side and cheer when your side makes a goal.
  • Ego builds up subsitute reality and the idea that “I’m separate”. In the beginning the one man - Adam, the spiritual man, lived in paradise. Yet his wife stole what they were told not to steal. They stole like we’re stealing from the world. So they got cast out and divided.
  • To be one - not to be divided at all. Come back to that primal state of being in paradise.
  • regular daily practice of turning to god. Meditation and prayer. This will lead the way and the ego falls behind. You simply grow out of it, of this childish selfishness.
  • Quote from Johns book “Wonders of Spiritual Enfoldment”: there is no more expectation of comfort or reliability in man, nor desire for the things of creation. World - a marvelous order of things including the disorder of man. But I feel ever less moved to participate.
  • Constant longing for god has become reality now.
  • You don’t lose it, you can’t find it. It’s just part of you, you merge into it. God’s no longer something separate and you’re fine. “Know I’m with you always”.
  • This is a billion times more effective than psychologists.
  • When you find this infinite presence there are no more questions, not more problems. Completion. Wonderful.
  • There is nothing, nothing that isn’t loved in this world. Even terrorists.
  • Ego is separate and makes everything else separate. We end up in living in a world of names.
  • Life of separation, life of name and form. Melt them.
  • Demonstrate my confidence in silence and not speaking. Show my disinterest in all that talking. Greater value mediate. Less talking
